intro: Astragalus bucegii, commonly known as the Bucegii milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Astragalus bucegii plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
